Package org.wmn4j.notation

Class Score

java.lang.Object
org.wmn4j.notation.Score
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Part>
public final class Score extends Object implements Iterable<Part>
Represents a score.

This class is immutable.

    Type for the different text attributes a score can have.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static Score of(Map<Score.Attribute,String> attributes, List<Part> parts)
      Returns a score with the given attributes and parts.
      Parameters:
      attributes - the attributes of the score
      parts - the parts in the score
      Returns:
      a score with the given attributes and parts

    • getFullMeasureCount

      public int getFullMeasureCount()
      Returns the number of full measures in this score.

      Pickup measures are not counted, that is, the number of measures is the same as the largest measure number in the score.

      Returns:
      the number of full measures in this score

    • getMeasureCount

      public int getMeasureCount()
      Returns the number of measures in this score.

      Pickup measures are included in the counte, that is, the number of measures is the same as the largest measure number in the score plus a possible pickup measure.

      Returns:
      the number of full measures in this score

    • hasPickupMeasure

      public boolean hasPickupMeasure()
      Returns true if this score has a pickup measure.
      Returns:
      true if this score has a pickup measure, false otherwise

    • getTitle

      public Optional<String> getTitle()
      Returns the main title of this score. If no title is set, then returns empty.
      Returns:
      the main title of this score

    • getPartCount

      public int getPartCount()
      Returns the number of parts in this score.
      Returns:
      number of parts in this score

    • getPart

      public Part getPart(int index)
      Returns the part at the index.
      Parameters:
      index - the number of the part in this score
      Returns:
      the part at the index

    • hasAttribute

      public boolean hasAttribute(Score.Attribute attribute)
      Returns true if the given attribute is set in this score.
      Parameters:
      attribute - the attribute whose presence is checked
      Returns:
      true if the given attribute is set in this score

    • getAttribute

      public Optional<String> getAttribute(Score.Attribute attribute)
      Returns the value of the given attribute. If the attribute is not present, then returns empty.
      Parameters:
      attribute - the type of the attribute
      Returns:
      the value of the attribute if the attribute is present

    • getAt

      public Durational getAt(Position position) throws NoSuchElementException
      Returns the durational notation object at the given position.
      Parameters:
      position - the position from which to get the element
      Returns:
      the notation object with duration at the given position
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the position is not found in this score

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Part> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<Part>

    • partwiseIterator

      public PositionIterator partwiseIterator()
      Returns an iterator that iterates the durational notation objects in partwise order.

      Starts by iterating through the part with the smallest number. Iterates through parts starting from smallest measure number. Iterates through measure voice by voice.

      Returns:
      an iterator that iterates the durational notation objects in partwise order

    • enumeratePartwise

      public Iterable<Positional> enumeratePartwise()
      Returns an iterable pairing of durationals with their positions.

      This behaves analogously to enumerate that in many programming language pairs elements of a collection with their indices.

      The durationals are iterated in partwise order similar to partwiseIterator().

      Returns:
      an iterable pairing of durationals with their positions

    • durationalStream

      public Stream<Durational> durationalStream()
      Returns a stream of the durational elements in this score.
      Returns:
      a stream of the durational elements in this score

    • positionalStream

      public Stream<Positional> positionalStream()
      Returns a stream of positional for the elements in this score.
      Returns:
      a stream of positional for the elements in this score

    • toSelection

      public Selection toSelection()
      Returns this score as a Selection.
      Returns:
      this score as a Selection

    • selectRange

      public Selection selectRange(int firstMeasure, int lastMeasure)
      Returns a range of measures of all parts in this score.
      Parameters:
      firstMeasure - the number of the first measure included in the range
      lastMeasure - the number of the last measure included in the range
      Returns:
      a range of measures of all parts in this score

    • selectParts

      public Selection selectParts(Collection<Integer> partIndices)
      Returns a selection of the score containing the parts at the given indices.
      Parameters:
      partIndices - the indices of the parts in this Score to be included in the selection
      Returns:
      a selection of the score containing the parts at the given * indices
